member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Server.IdentityType
member.summary: Represents different types of identity

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Server.IdentityType.ApplicationGroup
member.summary: An Application Group is defined by a Team Foundation Server, and only has meaning within this context.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Server.IdentityType.InvalidIdentity
member.summary: An identity for which a SID or distinguished name is not obtainable.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Server.IdentityType.NonCachedIdentity
member.summary: An identity which is not in the GSS cache.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Server.IdentityType.UnknownIdentityType
member.summary: An identity that is an AD object, having a SID and distinguished name, but is neither a user nor a group. A computer is an example of this type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Server.IdentityType.WindowsGroup
member.summary: A Windows Group defined on the local computer's SAM, or an AD user.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Server.IdentityType.WindowsUser
member.summary: A Windows User defined on the local computer's SAM, or an AD user.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Server.QueryMembership
member.summary: Specifies the constants that specify the level of detail returned in a query

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Server.QueryMembership.Direct
member.summary: Each Identity includes its direct members. However, these member identities will contain null members.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Server.QueryMembership.Expanded
member.summary: Each returned identity includes its direct members. Each of these member identities contain their direct member identities, and so on.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Server.QueryMembership.None
member.summary: No information about membership is returned, and corresponding properties are set to null.
